description:
The Karpenter Overview dashboard provides insight into your Karpenter Nodes, Pods, and Karpenter metrics. Clone this dashboard to make changes and add your own graph widgets.

### Useful Links

- [Datadog Karpenter integration documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/karpenter/)
title: Karpenter Overview

definition.content: Karpenter is a Kubernetes-based compute resource manager designed to handle your cluster's applications. This dashboard is crafted to provide you with an overview and detailed information about your clusters and the performance of Karpenter
Node Overview show a quick summary of all the Nodes that are provisioned or deprovisioned by Karpenter.

definition.title: Nodes Created by Karpenter by Reason
Nodes Deleted by Karpenter by Reason
Nodes Created in Timeframe by Karpenter
Nodes Deleted in Timeframe by Karpenter

definition.content: Resource request metrics displays resource request by pods bound to nodes. This is useful to understand the resource demand on your nodes.

The Pod Overview show a quick overview of all the pods that are running. This can be changed to view pods by Cluster, namespace, zone and instance type to help provide insights into specific group of pods.

definition.title: Count of Pods by Zone, Instance Type, Namespace and Phase
Average pod Startup Time by Node
Pod Overview by Zone, Instance Type, Node, Namespace and Phase

definition.content: Karpenter Provisioner lets users define how the cluster should provision nodes to meet demand. It includes specifications for target capacity, instance type, launch template, and provisioning strategy. Provisioner Overview metrics provides insights into the operation and performance of the provisioner.
Karpenter dynamically removes and adds nodes based on resource utilization. The following metrics collectively offer insights into the frequency and efficiency of the de-provisioning process.

definition.title: Deprovisioning Actions Performed by Action and Deprovisioner

definition.content: If interruption handling is enabled in Karpenter, the tool monitors various involuntary interruption events. When an upcoming interruption event is detected, Karpenter automatically takes actions such as tainting, draining, and terminating nodes in advance, allowing sufficient time for workload cleanup. The below metrics will give an oversight on the performance of the interruption process.

definition.title: Interrupt Actions Count by Action Type

definition.content: The Karpenter Controller manages node lifecycle in a Kubernetes cluster, scaling EC2 instances based on demand and available resources by provisioning and de-provisioning as needed. The below metrics displays some runtime performance metrics of the Karpenter controller.
Karpenter is Golang based. The below metrics displays some Go runtime metrics that can help in troubleshooting performance or bottleneck issues.
